universum.studios.android.ui.controller

Class PullController<V extends View & Pullable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.ui.controller.PullController<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of the pullable view.

    public class PullController<V extends View & Pullable>
extends Object
    PullController can be used to support pull feature for the scrollable views, especially collections like ListView or ScrollView. A view that wants to provide pull feature need to implement required Scrollable interface that specifies simple API needed for this controller to properly handle this feature.

    PullController supports pulling of the attached pullable view at its start and end depending on the view's orientation that is determined via Scrollable.getOrientation() by changing the view's top and bottom (View.offsetTopAndBottom(int)) or left and right (View.offsetLeftAndRight(int)) offset. Whether the pulling at start or end is enabled or not can be requested via setPullMode(int) and passing flags for the desired pull type. Visibility of pull can be requested via setPullVisibility(int, boolean) and also passing the desired pull flags.

    To receive callback about the current pull, a watcher needs to register Pullable.OnPullListener that receives callbacks about the started, performed, released or collapsed pull. Pullable.OnPullOverflowListener that can be also registered receives one callback about the pull overflow.

    There are a lot of properties that can be set to customize the pull behaviour, for example how much can be the view pulled (setPullDistance(float)), or how much time does the collapse pull animation takes (setPullCollapseDuration(long)).

    XML attributes

    PullController is meant to be used within views so it also supports set up from AttributeSet via setUpFromAttrs(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int, int) method that should be called from within a constructor of the pullable view that uses this controller to provide the pull feature. See PullController Attributes.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

                              int defStyleRes)
        Performs configuration of this controller from the given attrs.
        Parameters:
        context - Context used to obtain values for the given attributes.
        attrs - Set of attributes with values to be used to set up this controller.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource, for the view attached to this controller, within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the view attached to this controller.
        Returns:
        True if some setting of this controller has been changed, false otherwise.

      • setPullMode

        public void setPullMode(int mode)
        Sets the mode for pull to determine which pull to handle by this controller.
        Parameters:
        mode - The desired mode. One of START, END or theirs combination or NONE to disable pull.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullMode, getPullMode()

      • getPullMode

        public int getPullMode()
        Returns the current mode for pull.

        Default value: START | END

        Returns:
        Pull mode.
        See Also:
        setPullMode(int)

      • setPullVisibility

        public void setPullVisibility(int pull,
                              boolean visible)
        Sets a flag indicating whether a pull for the specified pull flags should be visible or not. This determines whether the attached pullable view should be really offset by this controller or not. If visibility is set to false for a specific pull, the pullable view will not be offset but pull callbacks will be still fired with computed pull value.
        Parameters:
        pull - The pull flags of which visibility to set.
        visible - True to set visible, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isPullVisible(int)

      • isPullVisible

        public boolean isPullVisible(int pull)
        Returns a flag indicating whether a pull for the specified pull flags is visible, so the pullable view is really offset by this controller, or not.
        Parameters:
        pull - The pull flags of which visibility to check.
        Returns:
        True if pull is visible, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setPullVisibility(int, boolean)

        Sets the interpolator for pull collapse animation.
        Parameters:
        interpolator - The desired interpolator used when collapsing pull by animation.

      • setPullCollapseFixedDurationEnabled

        public void setPullCollapseFixedDurationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the duration for pull collapse animation set by setPullCollapseDuration(long) should be used as fixed value or if it should be computed relatively to the distance of the current pull needed to collapse by animation.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to use fixed value, false to use relative value depends on the current pull to collapse.
        See Also:
        isPullCollapseFixedTimeEnabled()

      • isPullCollapseFixedTimeEnabled

        public boolean isPullCollapseFixedTimeEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the duration set by setPullCollapseDuration(long) is used as fixed value or relative value.

        Default value: false

        Returns:
        True if it is used as fixed, false as relative value.

      • setOverScrollAnimationEnabled

        public void setOverScrollAnimationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the over-scroll animation is played whenever the attached pullable view is over-scrolled, and specific criteria to play the animation are matched, or not.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to play over-scroll animation whenever dispatchOverScroll(int, int, boolean, boolean) is called upon this controller from the attached pullable view, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isOverScrollAnimationEnabled()

      • isOverScrollAnimationEnabled

        Returns:
        True if the animation is played, false otherwise.
        See Also:

      • shouldInterceptTouchEvent

        public boolean shouldInterceptTouchEvent(@NonNull
                                         MotionEvent event)
        Checks whether the attached view that received the specified motion event should intercept the event or not.
        Parameters:
        event - The motion event used to determine if to intercept or not.
        Returns:
        True if the event should be intercepted by the attached view so it should return true from within its ViewGroup.onInterceptTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent), false otherwise.

      • processTouchEvent

        public boolean processTouchEvent(@NonNull
                                 MotionEvent event)
        Processes the specified motion event received by the attached view. Based on the data of the event, this controller will perform pull upon the view if appropriate.
        Parameters:
        event - The motion event to be processed.
        Returns:
        True if the event was processed so attached view should return true from within its View.onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent), false otherwise.

      • onPullStarted

        protected void onPullStarted()
        Invoked from processTouchEvent(MotionEvent) whenever there has been observed touch motion that initiated the pull gesture. This is basically motion event with DOWN followed by MOVE action.

      • onApplyPull

        protected void onApplyPull(int pull,
                           float position)
        Invoked whenever pullBy(float) is called with a none zero offset and the new computed pull offset is different from the current one.

        Default implementation offsets the attached view at top/bottom or left/right depending on its orientation.

        Parameters:
        pull - The pull offset to apply to the attached view.
        position - New pull position determined from the new pull and available pull distance.

      • onPullOverflow

        protected void onPullOverflow(float pull,
                              float overflow,
                              float position)
        Invoked whenever onExpandPullBy(float) is called and the current pull value is already equal to getPullDistance() so the offset of the attached view is not being updated.
        Parameters:
        pull - The current pull value. Equals to getPullDistance().
        overflow - The new overflow value. With the value of pull this is the total distance pulled by a user.
        position - The current pull position determined from the current pull + pull overflow and available pull distance.

      • onPullReleased

        protected void onPullReleased(float pull,
                              float position)
        Invoked whenever a user releases the attached view during the pull gesture.

        Default implementation calls collapsePull() but inherited controllers may for example start here animation to collapse the specified pull for better user experience.

        Parameters:
        pull - Current pull value.
        position - Current pull position determined from the current pull and available pull distance.

      • onCollapsePull

        protected void onCollapsePull(float pull,
                              float position)
        Invoked whenever collapsePull() is called and there is currently some pull value to be collapsed.
        Parameters:
        pull - Current pull value to collapse.
        position - Current pull position determined from the current pull and available pull distance.

      • onPullCollapsed

        protected void onPullCollapsed()
        Invoked whenever handlePullCollapsed() is called. In most cases this will be due to fact that value of the pull has been decreased to 0.

      • dispatchOverScroll

        public boolean dispatchOverScroll(int scrollX,
                                  int scrollY,
                                  boolean clampedX,
                                  boolean clampedY)
        Called to dispatch over-scroll of the attached pullable view. If the pull is enabled and also pull over-scroll animation is enabled by setOverScrollAnimationEnabled(boolean), this will run over-scroll animation upon the pullable view which will look like same as the pull performed by a user.
        Parameters:
        scrollX - Current scroll X of the pullable view.
        scrollY - Current scroll Y of the pullable view.
        clampedX - True if scrollX was clamped to an over-scroll boundary, false otherwise.
        clampedY - True if scrollY was clamped to an over-scroll boundary, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if over-scroll animation has been started, false otherwise.

      • setPullMinVelocity

        public void setPullMinVelocity(float velocity)
        Sets the minimum velocity to initiate pull.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The desired velocity value for UiConfig.VELOCITY_UNITS units.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullMinVelocity, getPullMinVelocity()

      • getPullMinVelocity

        public float getPullMinVelocity()
        Returns the minimum velocity to initiate pull.

        Default value: 0

        Returns:
        Minimum velocity.
        See Also:
        setPullMinVelocity(float)

      • setPullDistance

        public void setPullDistance(float distance)
        Sets the distance which determines how much can be the attached view pulled.
        Parameters:
        distance - The desired value in pixels to determine maximum pull distance.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullDistance, getPullDistance(), setPullDistanceFraction(float)

      • getPullDistance

        public float getPullDistance()
        Returns the value of the maximum pull distance.

        Default value: see getPullDistanceFraction()

        Returns:
        Maximum pull distance in pixels or -1 if the pull distance cannot be right now resolved due to not initialized size of the attached view yet.
        See Also:
        setPullDistance(float)

      • setPullDistanceFraction

        public void setPullDistanceFraction(float fraction)
        Sets the fraction for the maximum pull distance which determines how much can be the attached view pulled. The specified fraction will be used to compute maximum pull distance from the size of the view.
        Parameters:
        fraction - The desired fraction from the range [0, 1f].
        See Also:
        ui:uiPullDistanceFraction, getPullDistanceFraction(), setPullDistance(float)

      • getPullDistanceFraction

        public float getPullDistanceFraction()
        Returns the fraction used to compute maximum pull distance.

        Default value: 0.25f

        Returns:
        Pull fraction from the range [0, 1f].
        See Also:
        setPullDistanceFraction(float)

      • setPullTransformer

        public void setPullTransformer(@NonNull
                               universum.studios.android.ui.controller.BasePullController.PullTransformer transformer)
        Sets the transformer used to transform computed value for the current pull.
        Parameters:
        transformer - The desired transformer.
        See Also:
        getPullTransformer()

      • getPullTransformer

        @NonNull
public universum.studios.android.ui.controller.BasePullController.PullTransformer getPullTransformer()
        Returns the current pull transformer of this PullController.

        By default, this controller uses transformer implementation with ResistanceInterpolator to transform computed pull offset value based on its current position.

        Returns:
        Pull transformer.
        See Also:
        setPullTransformer(PullTransformer)

      • setPullTransformerInterpolator

        public void setPullTransformerInterpolator(@NonNull
                                           Interpolator interpolator)
        Sets the interpolator for the default BasePullController.PullTransformer of this controller.

        Note, that this can be applied only in case, when there is still default pull transformer used. If there is custom transformer set, that transformer should handle interpolation logic.

        Parameters:
        interpolator - The desired interpolator for the current pull transformer.

      • onExpandPullBy

        protected boolean onExpandPullBy(float offset)
        Invoked from processTouchEvent(MotionEvent) whenever there has been observed touch motion that should expand the current pull. This is basically motion event with MOVE action directed from the pull origin.

        Default implementation updates the current pull via pullBy(float) method with the specified offset and in case of pull overflow invokes onPullOverflow(float, float, float) with the computed overflow and the current pull position.

        Parameters:
        offset - The offset by which to expand the current pull.
        Returns:
        Always true.

      • onCollapsePullBy

        protected boolean onCollapsePullBy(float offset)
        Invoked from processTouchEvent(MotionEvent) whenever there has been observed touch motion that should collapse the current pull. This is basically motion event with MOVE action directed to the pull origin.

        Default implementation updates the current pull via pullBy(float) method with the specified offset and in case of collapsed pull invokes onPullCollapsed().

        Parameters:
        offset - The offset by which to collapse the current pull.
        Returns:
        True if there remained some pull to be collapsed yet, false otherwise.

      • pullBy

        protected final void pullBy(float offset)
        Performs pull by the given offset using PullHelper implementation specific for orientation of the attached view.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset by which to pull.

      • setViewFrozen

        protected void setViewFrozen(boolean frozen)
        Sets the attached view frozen/un-frozen so it cannot to respond to user touches while the pull is being performed.
        Parameters:
        frozen - True to froze (disable, set un-pressed) the view, false otherwise.

      • collapsePull

        protected final void collapsePull()
        Collapses the current pull if there is any via onCollapsePull(float, float) or notifies that the pull is already collapsed via onPullCollapsed().
